line_1: Why should not fools the foolish thus caress;
line_2: Let not neglect or distance e'er oppress,
Extol the days of good Queen BESS,

line_1: And lure thee to the chaste caress;
line_2: Yes, I had hopes, at least to press,

line_1: Do men for this so fondly life caress,
But yet, in Private, like dear Friends caress,
line_2: And form Designs, poor Players to distress.

line_1: And serve Her God, whose Person I caress.
line_2: To each new Harlot I new Altars dress;
